translated: Elder’s Birth Stories🔽. The Chapter with Sal-flower-offering Elder
. The Elder Setudāyaka’s Birth Story
“In the presence of the Fortunate One Vipassī,
while he was walking up and down,
with a confident mind and a happy mind
I had a bridge built.
For ninety-one aeons,
the bridge that I had built,
I do not know of a bad destination,
this is the fruit of the bridge-offering.
My defilements have been burned up,
… and so on …
I live undefiled.
It was surely a good thing for me,
… and so on …
the Teacher’s instruction has been fulfilled.
The four analytical insights,
… and so on …
the Teacher’s instruction has been fulfilled.”

original: Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā setudāyako thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.
analyzed: ittham sudam āyasmā setudāyakaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati
translated: Thus it was that the Elder Setudāyaka recited these verses.
The Elder Setudāyaka’s Birth Story, the fourth.
